column4: openoffice channel is not very responsive. Do I need Java JRE if I want to use Base? Is there an open JRE and would you recommend it vs. the Java JRE (karmic here). Thanks
not needed except for some menu
wizards etc wont work
open office is a heavy package really, try the individual word processors abiword and gnumeric for spread sheets
rww, if I don't need it for Base, what is the point? I don't really care about wizards, I leave that to MS Office
btw, i forgot what base is, like access?
yes, but I will use it as a front end with postgresql
ok
with sudo apt-get install wine
same I don't want to run, I want to open it
yes install wine first
with the command sudo apt-get install wine
then just double click and open exe
to open (see the content of a .exe)? Wine will run it, I don't want that
an exe can never be opened
do you mean on Linux? of course you can open them on Windoze when you decompile a software
yes when you decompile, but your question is different
is there a Linux software to decompile .exe?
no idea
thanks
FIY, I found one decompiler running on Ubuntu, boomerang, http://boomerang.sourceforge.net/ reading the doc now
